title.native: 血界戦線 王様のレストランの王様
title.romaji: Kekkai Sensen: Ousama no Restaurant no Ousama
title.english: Blood Blockade Battlefront: King of Kings Restaurant Fit for a King

description: An adaptation of a story in the 8th volume on the Kekkai Sensen manga.
synonyms: Kekkai Sensen: Ou-sama no Restaurant no Ou-sama

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

name.native: レオナルド・ウォッチ
クラウス・V・ラインヘルツ
ツェッド・オブライエン
スティーブン・Ａ・スターフェイズ

node.description:
Yasuhiro Nightow is a Japanese manga artist and game creator who created the anime and manga Trigun. Nightow was born in Yokohama, Japan. He moved to Yokosuka when he was in elementary school, and spent the junior high and high school years in Shizuoka.

Before the release of the popular manga, Trigun, Nightow studied social science and then majored in media studies. Nightow became popular in the US thanks to the US release of Trigun. Trigun, the TV series, had a limited broadcast run in 1998.

Nightow also created the characters and story for the Sega/Red Entertainment anime and third-person shooter video game series Gungrave.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nightow)

She rose to prominence as one of the youngest anime directors and one of the few female directors in the industry. 

She made her debut in the industry in 2006, working as an assistant episode director on [Futari wa Precure: Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). In 2010, she directed the film [Heartcatch Precure! Hana no Miyako de Fashion Show... Desu ka!?](https://anilist.co/anime/9288/), her first work as head director. A few years later she directed [Kyousougiga](https://anilist.co/anime/19703/), which was well received. More recently, her direction of 2015's [Blood Blockade Battlefront](https://anilist.co/anime/20727/) earned her praise.

She rose to prominence as one of the youngest anime directors and one of the few female directors in the industry. 

She made her debut in the industry in 2006, working as an assistant episode director on [Futari wa Precure: Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). In 2010, she directed the film [Heartcatch Precure! Hana no Miyako de Fashion Show... Desu ka!?](https://anilist.co/anime/9288/), her first work as head director. A few years later she directed [Kyousougiga](https://anilist.co/anime/19703/), which was well received. More recently, her direction of 2015's [Blood Blockade Battlefront](https://anilist.co/anime/20727/) earned her praise.

A co-founder and a board member of [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Upon graduating from high school, Kawamoto was first employed in the making and designing of precision machinery. During this early period, he became interested in becoming an animator due to the ongoing [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) series, [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/)'s [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) and [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/)'s amateur [Daicon](https://anilist.co/anime/2724/) films. In particular, [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/)'s work was a major influence.

After graduating, he applied for a small sub-contracting studio called Group Donguri and was accepted. In 1986, he made his debut in Yasuhiko's 1986 film [Arion](https://anilist.co/anime/791/). During the production he was mentored by the character designer [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/), with whom he would later work with on multiple occasions, including being her assistant in [Venus Wars](https://anilist.co/anime/544/), which was also written and directed by Yasuhiko. After this Kawamoto worked on numerous series by [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), most notably as a character designer on the Gundam entries, [Stardust Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/84/) and [The 08th MS Team](https://anilist.co/anime/81/), as well as the internationally acclaimed [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/).

In 1998, he co-founded Bones with fellow Sunrise staff members [Masahiko Minami](https://anilist.co/staff/101519/) and [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/). Some of the more recent works he has provided designs for include [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/), [Ghost Slayers Ayashi](https://anilist.co/anime/1587/), [Noragami](https://anilist.co/anime/20447/) and [Kekkai Sensen](https://anilist.co/anime/20727/).

**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!
- Character Design - "Gigantic Drive" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam A year of War" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Cross Dimension 0079" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam F91 Formula Senki 0122" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Return of Zion" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Senki" (Video game)
- Character Design - "OUT LIVE Be Eliminate Yesterday" (Video game)
- Character Design - "OUT LIVE" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Wonder Project J" (Video game)
- Character Design - "Robot Alchemic Drive" (Video game)
- Assistant Chief Animation Director - "OVER THE MONOCHROME RAINBOW" (Video game)
- Animation Director - "Ghost in the Shell" (Video game)
- Animation Director - "Kidou Senshi Gundam" (Video game)
- Key Animation for "Ghost in the Shell" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Kidou Senshi Gundam Cross Dimension 0079" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Kidou Senshi Gundam PERFECT ONE YEAR WAR" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Kidou Senshi Gundam" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Serial Experiments Lain" (Video game)
- Key Animation - "Spiral Zone" (ep 5)!~

He does a wide range of design works.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.

A co-founder and a board member of [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Upon graduating from high school, Kawamoto was first employed in the making and designing of precision machinery. During this early period, he became interested in becoming an animator due to the ongoing [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) series, [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/)'s [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) and [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/)'s amateur [Daicon](https://anilist.co/anime/2724/) films. In particular, [Yoshikazu Yasuhiko](https://anilist.co/staff/97220/)'s work was a major influence.

After graduating, he applied for a small sub-contracting studio called Group Donguri and was accepted. In 1986, he made his debut in Yasuhiko's 1986 film [Arion](https://anilist.co/anime/791/). During the production he was mentored by the character designer [Sachiko Kamimura](https://anilist.co/staff/112663/), with whom he would later work with on multiple occasions, including being her assistant in [Venus Wars](https://anilist.co/anime/544/), which was also written and directed by Yasuhiko. After this Kawamoto worked on numerous series by [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), most notably as a character designer on the Gundam entries, [Stardust Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/84/) and [The 08th MS Team](https://anilist.co/anime/81/), as well as the internationally acclaimed [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/).

In 1998, he co-founded Bones with fellow Sunrise staff members [Masahiko Minami](https://anilist.co/staff/101519/) and [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/). Some of the more recent works he has provided designs for include [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/), [Ghost Slayers Ayashi](https://anilist.co/anime/1587/), [Noragami](https://anilist.co/anime/20447/) and [Kekkai Sensen](https://anilist.co/anime/20727/).

Highly praised for his mechanical drawings by [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/).
